articles.title: WPK Birthday to Be Marked in Russia
DPRK's Stand on Solution to Nuclear Issue Reiterated
articles.content:
WPK Birthday to Be Marked in Russia 
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- A decision on organizing a preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea was adopted at a meeting of the Executive Committee of the Central Council of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia on September 21.
 The meeting discussed the matter of significantly celebrating the 60th birthday of the WPK and the preparatory committee was formed with Chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity S.Z. Umalatova as its chairwoman and six members of the Party leadership as its members.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful events such as a seminar and carry an article on the newspaper of the party in celebration of the WPK birthday.

articles.title: Motion Calling for Nat'l Assembly's Ratification of Proposal for Rice Negotiations under Fire
articles.content:
DPRK's Stand on Solution to Nuclear Issue Reiterated 
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will closely follow how the U.S. will move at the phase of "action for action" in the future.
 A DPRK delegate declared this at a plenary session of the Geneva Conference on Disarmament on September 22, referring to the close of the second phase of the fourth six-party talks on the nuclear issue between the DPRK and the U.S.
 The DPRK approached the talks with magnanimity, patience and sincerity, proceeding from the principled, fair and aboveboard stand to achieve the general goal of the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula at any cost, and at last succeeded in meeting all the challenges, making it possible to agree on the joint statement, "verbal commitments," he noted, and went on:    
 The joint statement reflects the DPRK's consistent stand on the settlement of the DPRK-U.S. nuclear issue and, at the same time, the commitments of the U.S. and south Korea responsible for denuclearizing the whole of the Korean Peninsula.
 The DPRK will feel no need to keep even a single nuclear weapon if its relations with the U.S. are normalized, bilateral confidence is built and it is not exposed to the U.S. nuclear threat any longer.    
 What is most essential is, therefore, for the U.S. to provide light water reactors to the DPRK as early as possible as evidence proving the former's substantial recognition of the latter's nuclear activity for a peaceful purpose.

articles.title: Serious Soil Pollution in U.S. Military Base in S. Korea
articles.content:
Motion Calling for Nat'l Assembly's Ratification of Proposal for Rice Negotiations under Fire in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The lawmakers from the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea occupied the place where government policies are examined by the Unification, Diplomacy and Trade Committee of the National Assembly (NA) and went on a sit-in struggle there in protest against the motion calling for the NA ratification of the proposal on rice negotiations on Sept. 23, according to south Korean KBS.
 They charged that the NA should not take up the above-said proposal unless the demands of the peasants are reflected in it.    
 Earlier, the Democratic Workers' Party and peasants bodies called a press conference at which they held that the suspicion about the agreement reached at the rice negotiations has not yet been clarified and the adverse impact it will have on the living of the peasants has not been examined, holding that there is no ground to introduce the motion to the NA.

articles.title: WPK's Birthday Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
Serious Soil Pollution in U.S. Military Base in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The soil pollution in U.S. military base to be returned to the south Korean side this year is very serious, according to south Korean CBS on Sept. 22.
 The Environment and Labor Committee of the National Assembly made public the result of investigation into the 15 places of the U.S. base expected to be returned. According to it, the content of hydrocarbon of land exceeded 100 times, solder 102 times and copper 20 times as much as the tolerable limits.

Congratulations to Albanian Prime Minister
Congratulations to Albanian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Albanian Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Sali Berisha on his appointment as prime minister of Albania.
 Believing that the relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in conformity with the long tradition of friendship and cooperation and in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished him success in his new job for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: WHO Southeast Asian Regional Office Chief Here
articles.content:
Congratulations to Albanian Foreign Minister 
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Besnik Mustafaj on his appointment as Albanian foreign minister.
 Expressing the belief that the relations between the two countries would develop in various fields, the message wished him great success in his new job.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
WHO Southeast Asian Regional Office Chief Here
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Director of the Regional Office for South-East Asia of the WHO Samlee Plianbangchang and his party arrived here Tuesday.
 They were met at the airport by an official concerned and the resident representative of the WHO in the DPRK.

articles.title: Successes Made in Light Industry
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea headed by Chairman of its Central Committee Ryom Sun Gil left here Tuesday to attend the 18th meeting of the Presidential Council of the World Federation of Trade Unions to be held in France, commemorations of the 100th anniversary of the start of the Trade Union Movement of Russia to be held in Russia and other functions. 
 It was seen off at the airport by Vice-Chairman of the Central Committee of the GFTUK Kim Yong Do and Councillor of the Russian embassy here Mikhail Vetrov.
 Arriving here today was a delegation of the Foreign Ministry of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam headed by Deputy-Minister Nguyen Phu Binh.
